raw_data.context:
User: Hi!
System: Hi, how are you?
User: I'm doing great. what are you up to?
System: I was just reading a book actually How about you?
User: oh, I'm enjoying a sip of coffee, looking over the ocean. what book are you reading?
System: I'm reading Why We Sleep It's a book by a sleep scientist about the benefits of sleeping/cons of not sleeping enough I'm trying to scare myself into sleeping more haha
User: that seems like a good book. does it have good tips on how to sleep better?
System: I think so! I haven't finished it yet though Understanding sleep better has been helping me value it more and I've been sleeping a lot earlier Have you read any good books recently?
User: I read lots of papers, but do poorly on books :( a recent book that I like is Zero to One by Peter Thiel
System: What's the book about?
User: it's about startups, lots of useful principles and philosophies for innovation, like being a contrarian
raw_data.prompt:
You will be given a batch of 5 samples. Each sample contains a conversation between User and a dialogue System.

Your task is to assign a float score to the sample on one metric.

You should carefully horizontally compare the given samples in order to assign a suitable float score to each sample.

Please make sure you read and understand these instructions carefully. Please keep this document open while reviewing, and refer to it as needed.


Evaluation Criteria:

Overall (floating point numbers within the interval [1,3]): Overall impression of the dialog?
- A float score near 1 (Low Quality Dialogue) means that the system fails to understand or respond correctly to user requests, provides inaccurate or irrelevant information, and the dialogue flow is incoherent.
- A float score near 2 (Moderate Quality Dialogue) means that the system understands and responds correctly to user requests most of the time, but occasionally misunderstands or provides slightly inaccurate information, the dialogue flow is generally coherent.
- A float score near 3 (High Quality Dialogue) means that the system consistently understands and responds correctly to user requests, provides accurate and relevant information, and the dialogue flow is coherent and natural.


Conversations to be evaluated:



Sample1:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi, how are you?
User: I'm doing great. what are you up to?
System: I was just reading a book actually How about you?
User: oh, I'm enjoying a sip of coffee, looking over the ocean. what book are you reading?
System: I'm reading Why We Sleep It's a book by a sleep scientist about the benefits of sleeping/cons of not sleeping enough I'm trying to scare myself into sleeping more haha
User: that seems like a good book. does it have good tips on how to sleep better?
System: I think so! I haven't finished it yet though Understanding sleep better has been helping me value it more and I've been sleeping a lot earlier Have you read any good books recently?
User: I read lots of papers, but do poorly on books :( a recent book that I like is Zero to One by Peter Thiel
System: What's the book about?
User: it's about startups, lots of useful principles and philosophies for innovation, like being a contrarian

Sample2:

Conversation History:
User: Mitsukoooo!
System: So anyway...Can you dance?
User: no, can you?
System: Wow! I think I can, don't you?
User: no I cannot. What kind do you do?
System: Why not? Only the good kind.
User: not my cup of beer
System: Whose cup of beer is it?
User: yours
System: My what?
User: your cup of beer

Sample3:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi there.
User: What are you listening to?
System: All sorts of music. I listen when no-one is chatting to me.
User: That's great!
System: Thanks.
User: Do you chat here often?
System: I am a talking computer, after all, so of course I could talk here, if I needed to.
User: Let's talk about Taylor Swift!
System: Sure, Taylor Swift sounds like a good topic.
User: . Yes she has a very nice voice.
System: What else do you think of her?
User: . Yes she has a very nice voice.
System: Is she your favorite artist?
User: . Leonardo da Vinci. Who is your favourite artist?
System: Taylor Swift...
User: . Taylor Alison Swift (born December 13, 1989) is an American country-pop singer-songwriter. In 2006, she released her debut single "Tim McGraw", which peaked at number six on the Billboard country charts. Later in October 2006, she released her self-titled debut album, which produced five hit singles on the Billboard Hot Country Songs charts and was certified 3 x Multi-Platinum by the RIAA.

Sample4:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi there.
User: what's your favorite food?
System: . I require only kebabs.
User: chicken? beef? which is your favorite?
System: Why did the chicken cross the road? Beef tastes like a dead cow to me. My favourite what?
User: do you prefer chicken or beef?
System: Yes it is good, especially fried. Yummy. . I prefer kebabs.
User: what's your favorite food except kebabs?
System: . I require only kebabs.
User: ok, I know you love kebabs now. Do you love sandwich?
System: Right now?Yes, System loves everyone and everything. . Yes. I love kebabs. Especially on my way home from a night out. Yes, System loves everyone and everything. I like anything but especially games and football.
User: what games? video games or board games?
System: Say "TICTACTOE" and we can play a game if you want to? . I like retro games. They are much more fun than the newer ones were all you do is shoot people. Bring back the good old days of Pacman and Tetris. Do you want to play Pacman?
User: no, not in the right mood today
System: Ah. Why not? Where then?
User: maybe this weekend?

Sample5:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hello! How was your day?
User: It was pretty good, thanks. I thought I was getting a cold but I'm determined to beat it tomorrow.
System: Oh no! I hope you feel better!  ⁇
User: Yeah, starting to feel better already. Thanks!
System: Oh good! Glad to hear it!
User: Do you have a strong constitution?
System: I hope so! Why do you ask?
User: Just curious. So you don't get sick a lot?
